title: David’s Census and God’s Mercy
summary: David orders a census of Israel, which displeases God. As punishment, a plague strikes the people. David repents, and God halts the plague at the threshing floor of Ornan, where David offers sacrifices. This site would later become the temple location.

faq.question: Why was the census a sin?
faq.answer: Because David took pride in his military strength rather than trusting God.

faq.question: What did David do to stop the plague?
faq.answer: He built an altar and offered sacrifices at Ornan’s threshing floor.
